title: Old-age dependency ratio by state and union territory in India 2011
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The Old-age dependency ratio of State And Union Territory Kerala is 1.88% larger than the minimum value at Delhi.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The maximum Old-age dependency ratio 19.6 is found at State And Union Territory Kerala and the minimum is found at Delhi where State And Union Territory is 10.4.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The Old-age dependency ratio of State And Union Territory Kerala is 1.88% larger than the minimum value at Delhi.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
State And Union Territory Kerala has the highest Old-age dependency ratio and Delhi has the lowest Old-age dependency ratio.
There is a difference of 9.2 between the maximum State And Union Territory Kerala and minimum State And Union Territory Delhi.
Old-age dependency ratio at State And Union Territory Kerala is 19.6 , second place is  at 19.6, and thirdly is Tamil Nadu at 15.8.
State And Union Territory Andaman & Nicobar Islands, and Odisha have the same Old-age dependency ratio.
The State And Union Territory Delhi tends to be 1.39 percent lower than average.
